summary: This is a letter from the SMART Office of the Department of Justice dated April 23, 2020, responding to a request for information on Jeffrey Epstein's international travel as a registered sex offender from 2008 to 2019. The SMART Office states it does not maintain records on individual offenders and directs the requester to other federal agencies.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the information request regarding his international travel history from June 2008 to August 2019 while registered as a sex offender.

events.title: Epstein's Registration as a Sex Offender
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein registered as a sex offender.

events.title: End Date of Travel Inquiry
events.description: The request for Epstein's travel information covers the period up to August 2019.

keyFacts: The SMART Office of the DOJ explicitly states it does not and has never maintained records or files on individual sex offenders, including Jeffrey Epstein.
The letter confirms a specific request was made on April 2, 2020, for records of every occasion Jeffrey Epstein traveled outside the U.S. from June 2008 to August 2019.
The SMART Office directs the requester to contact the U.S. Marshals Service, INTERPOL-Washington, the FBI, or the DHS Angel Watch Center for potential travel information.
The document establishes that Epstein was a registered sex offender as of June 2008.
